021877214995244190654.description:
We are seeking a skilled Automation Engineer to help develop a solution for automating data entry and form autofill workflows for custom use cases. The project involves creating scripts to input user-provided data into various online forms, ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and seamless operation.  
  
Project Scope  
The project will focus on creating a robust and flexible automation tool for streamlining data entry tasks. The tool will:  
  
Retrieve structured data (e.g., user information, text inputs, file uploads) from a database or API.  
Autofill and submit the data into specific online forms or systems.  
Implement techniques to ensure compatibility and reliability across multiple platforms.  
Key Deliverables  
Custom Form Autofill Tool:  
  
Create scripts to autofill and submit data into online forms, tailored for each platform.  
Handle dynamic fields, dropdown menus, file uploads, and multi-step forms.  
Error Handling and Reporting:  
  
Implement error detection to identify issues like failed submissions or incorrect data formats.  
Provide detailed logs to monitor script performance and identify errors.  
Scalable Architecture:  
  
Design a solution that can handle varying volumes of data entry tasks efficiently.  
Ensure compatibility with different platforms and form structures.  
Performance Optimization:  
  
Minimize input errors and submission failures.  
Optimize execution speed while maintaining data accuracy.  
Requirements  
Technical Skills:  
  
Proficiency in Python or other relevant programming languages.  
Experience with web automation frameworks like Selenium.  
Ability to work with APIs, databases, and data manipulation tools.  
Experience:  
  
Proven track record of developing automation tools for data entry or form submissions.  
Knowledge of handling multi-step forms and dynamic fields.  
Problem-Solving:  
  
Ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues with compatibility, form structures, or data mismatches.  
Experience optimizing workflows for efficiency and reliability.  
Additional Information  
Data Source: The data to be entered will be provided via API or other structured formats.  
Target Platforms: A list of platforms will be provided, and scripts must be tailored to handle their unique requirements.  
Error Logs: Detailed reporting is essential to monitor performance and troubleshoot issues effectively.  
This project is ideal for automation engineers who enjoy creating efficient, reliable tools that simplify repetitive workflows. If you’re interested, please share your experience, examples of similar work, and your proposed approach to building these automation scripts.

021877148463587724222.description:
I am seeking a developer or automation specialist to build a system that:

1. Parses incoming property leads (via email and/or SMS) to extract relevant
information (address, price, units, etc.).

2. Queries RentCast (or a similar rent estimate service) to gather rental
data (current rent, rent comps, etc.).

3. Populates a Google Sheet with key data (address, rent estimate, cash-on-
cash return, etc.).

4. Handles special logic for multi-unit properties (7+ units) to store or
transform data differently.

5. Keeps daily API costs to under $0.50/day.


---

2. Project Goals



Automation: Eliminate manual copy-pasting of property addresses, rent
estimates, and ROI calculations.

Accuracy: Ensure data extracted and rent estimates are consistently accurate.

Scalability & Cost Control: Handle a growing number of leads while staying
within a $0.50/day API budget.



---

3. Scope and Requirements



3.1. Data Capture & Parsing

1. Sources: The system should capture data from:

Email: Some leads arrive via email (with property details or direct links to
listings).

Text Messages (SMS): Some leads arrive via text, which may be forwarded
through services like Twilio or Zapier.



2. Parsing Fields:

Address (required for RentCast lookup)

Property Purchase Price (if available)

Number of Units (important for 7+ unit logic)

Any additional fields that might be relevant (e.g., link to the listing,
agent’s contact info, etc.).



3. Preferred Tools (flexible):

Zapier, Make (Integromat), or a custom solution in Python/Node.js/Google Apps
Script.

Must ensure reliability and easy maintainability.




3.2. RentCast Integration

1. Retrieve Rent Estimates:

Use RentCast’s API (or equivalent) to get current rent, high/low estimates, or
average rents for the ZIP code.

If the property listing already contains the current rent, incorporate that
into the data.



2. API Cost Constraints:

The system should not exceed $0.50/day in API usage.

Minimize duplicates: Only call RentCast once per unique address.

Potentially batch calls or check for repeated addresses.




3.3. Google Sheets Integration

1. Data Columns in Google Sheets should include (but aren’t limited to):

Timestamp (date the lead was processed)

Address

Purchase Price

Number of Units

Monthly Rent Estimate

Other rent comps or relevant data from RentCast

Cash-on-Cash Return (see next section)

Notes or Status field for manual follow-up.



2. Handling 7+ Units:

If Units less than 7, either:

Insert data into a separate tab (e.g., “7+ Units” tab), or

Encode or summarize the data differently (e.g., partial data, redacted
financials).





3.4. Cash-on-Cash Return Calculation

1. Inputs:

Purchase Price (from the lead or manually estimated)

Rent (from the listing and/or RentCast estimates)

Down Payment (might be a standard % or a column in the sheet)

Expenses (option to assume a percentage or a fixed amount)

Mortgage Payment (if financed; can be estimated or left as a variable input)



2. Formula:

Annual Net Cash Flow = (Monthly Rent – Monthly Expenses – Mortgage) × 12

Total Cash Invested = Down Payment + Closing Costs (if applicable)

Cash-on-Cash Return % = (Annual Net Cash Flow / Total Cash Invested) × 100



3. Implementation:

Can be calculated within Google Sheets (preferred for easier tweaking of
assumptions).

Alternatively, can be calculated in the automation script.




3.5. Error Handling & Edge Cases

1. Duplicate Addresses: If the same property address is sent multiple times,
ensure we do not duplicate RentCast calls unnecessarily.


2. Missing Data: Some leads may be missing purchase price or unit count. The
system should log them but still attempt to fill whatever data is available.


3. Notification/Logging: If a lead is processed successfully, optionally send
a notification (email or Slack) if it meets a certain ROI threshold
(optional).




---

4. Technical Details & Constraints


5. Platform/Hosting:

If using a no-code tool (Zapier, Make), you must specify the steps needed.

If using a custom script (e.g., Google Apps Script or a serverless function),
it must be well-documented for future maintenance.



6. User Authentication:

Securely handle the RentCast API key (do not store in plain text in public
code repositories).



7. Daily API Budget:

Provide a method to track the number of calls to ensure we stay under
$0.50/day.

Implement caching or a check on previously-seen addresses.



8. Google Sheet Setup:

Must be able to handle 100+ properties without performance issues.

Must accommodate dynamic columns for additional data or notes.





---

5. Deliverables


6. Fully Functional Automated Workflow

Demonstrates end-to-end process: from an example email/SMS to data populating
in Google Sheets with rent estimates and calculations.



7. Configuration & Setup Guide

Instructions on how to set up or modify the API keys (RentCast, Twilio, etc.).

Instructions on how to edit the Google Sheet formulas or columns.



8. Source Code/Access

If code-based: Provide the script files or links to GitHub.

If no-code: Provide screenshots or instructions for the Zapier/Make workflows.



9. Testing & Validation

At least one test property address to confirm the system retrieves rent data,
calculates ROI, and handles the 7+ unit logic.



10. Documentation

A short write-up on how to maintain and troubleshoot the system in case of
errors (e.g., API downtime, changes in email format).





---

6. Timeline



Proposal Submission: Immediately upon job posting.

Project Start: Within 1 week of awarding the job.

MVP Completion: 1–2 weeks after project start (basic address parsing + rent
data retrieval + sheet entry).

Final Delivery: 2–3 weeks after project start (include the ROI calculations,
7+ unit handling, thorough testing).



---

7. Budget



Open to proposals, with an emphasis on:

Minimizing monthly costs (aiming for $15/month total, including the RentCast
usage).

Ensuring reliability of the automation.



---

8. Selection Criteria


9. Relevant Experience: Experience with property analysis, automating
email/SMS parsing, Google Sheets, or Zapier/Make.


10. Portfolio/References: Previous work or references for similar automation
tasks.


11. Solution Approach: Clear plan to keep API calls under $0.50/day, handle
duplicates, and maintain data integrity.


12. Communication & Documentation: Ability to provide clear instructions and
maintenance guidance.




---

9. How to Apply / Next Steps



Submit a brief proposal explaining:

1. Your approach (Zapier? Custom script?)


2. High-level architecture you envision


3. Estimated timeline and cost



Provide examples or links to similar projects you’ve completed.
Include the word “PropertyROI” in your response to confirm you’ve read the
details.


---

missing quality questions about property

created accounts on my WordPress site. I am using JWT authentification.  
  
However, I'm having trouble getting it to identify whether they have purchased
a subscription and if it is active. The subscription plugin I am using is
SUBSCRIPTIONS FOR WOOCOMMERCE by WP Swings.  
  
I need a developer to execute this implementation. I want to create a
marketing site where users can purchase subscription access and create an
account.  
  
Then, we can identify if those users have an account and a subscription to the
web app. If they have a subscription, I would like to give them access to the

A previous developer helped me build an AI voice agent in VAPI and n8n.  
  
The agent currently takes inbound calls like a receptionist. The agent responds to callers giving business information, pricing and FAQs. It also sets appointments by looking at a calendar (already setup) and suggests available times.  
  
Current tech stack  
GCP - google calendar  
N8n - workflows  
VAPI - voice AI  
OpenAI - chat summarisation  
Twilio - phone number  
  
We are stuck on a Stripe implementation where the agent sends a payment link (eg via email or SMS) to the caller to make a payment to confirm the appointment. Need support specifically in completing this part of the flow.  
  
So the flow should be  
1. Caller rings number  
2.  AI agent answers and provides business information, and offers to  set up an appointment   
3. Callers asks availability on certain days  
4. agent checks calendar and confirms or proposes alternative times  
5. Caller agree on time, agent books the appointment and sends calendar
invite and confirms booking over phone, then politely ends call.  
  
  
Additional step to be added  
- before step 5 above, Agent asks caller for email address to send a payment
link (stripe)  
- after caller completes payment - agent checks for payment confirmation. If
confirmed, agent tells caller that the payment is successful and then we move
to step 5 above.  
- If payment unsuccessful, it tells caller that it was unsuccessful and asks
to try again. If still unsuccessful, it tells caller that the appointment is
not confirmed and that we will pass on to someone who will call back to take
payment over the phone.  
  
This should be a quick integration as it is testing the flow and stripe
integration. We have done most of the work and requires an experienced AI
agent to complete.  
  
This must be completed by Friday this week.

021876909175860039060.description:
We are looking to build an AI-powered classroom website for teachers, very similar in functionality to Google Classroom except this will include AI chat tasks that are graded.  
  
The website will allow teachers to create and manage multiple classrooms for different subjects. In each classroom, the teacher can upload educational content in the form of PDF files to serve as modules. Students can access and complete tasks.  
  
Features:  
  
    Teachers can create modules and upload PDF files with relevant content.  
    Teachers can set instructions for the AI bot (e.g., "10 questions a day on addition").  
    Students log into their profiles daily, select the module, and interact with the AI chatbot.  
    The AI bot will present 10 questions, and when the student answers correctly, it will proceed to the next question. If the student answers incorrectly, the bot will explain the mistake and allow the student to ask questions before moving forward.  
    At the end of the 10 questions, the AI bot records the student’s score, which is saved in a gradebook similar to Google Classroom.  
    The platform tracks the student’s overall progress and grades across multiple modules (e.g., Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division for math).  
  
Teacher’s Dashboard:  
  
    Teachers can monitor student progress, view grades, and track the completion of modules.  
    Teachers can create different classrooms for various subjects and upload multiple modules for each.  
  
Additional Requirement: The website should be designed with future mobile app
integration in mind. We plan to transition the platform into a mobile app
(iOS) via the App Store at a later point, allowing students to easily access
and complete their modules on their phones. Please design the site with this
scalability in mind.  
  
Requirements:  
  
    Experience in building interactive web platforms with AI integration.  
    Familiarity with building gradebook systems and dashboards for educators.  
    Experience with chatbot development and AI-powered learning tools.  
    WordPress is the preferred platform for this project. We are looking for a developer who is experienced with WordPress and its plugins. Please include suggestions for any plugins you would consider using to build the site.  
  
To Be Considered: If you are interested in this project, please submit a proof
of concept. This could include any past AI-integrated projects (student,
teacher, or user group projects, etc.) and a clear plan for how you would
execute this project. Please include details on the plugins you would use, how
you would integrate the AI functionality, and any tools or technologies you
would recommend for this build.

Here are some examples of how the newsletter should look:  - <https://www.180marketing.com/this-month-in-ecommerce-seo-may-2024/>  - <https://www.180marketing.com/this-month-in-ecommerce-seo-june-2024/>  - <https://www.180marketing.com/this-month-in-ecommerce-seo-july-2024/>    Here's the process we've been doing manually so far:    Step 1 - Find recently published articles to feature in the newsletter that would appeal to eCommerce store owners who are interested/curious about SEO. Here's a list of approved sources to pull articles from:  <https://sparktoro.com/blog/> <https://detailed.com/latest/> <https://zyppy.com/seo/> <https://www.growth-memo.com/archive> <https://ipullrank.com/blog> <https://www.semrush.com/blog/> <https://ahrefs.com/blog/> <https://searchengineland.com/library/seo> <https://www.seroundtable.com/category/google> <https://www.searchenginejournal.com/category/seo/> <https://brodieclark.com/notes/>    Step 2 - Write a 1 paragraph summary with 2-4 sentences for each for each article.    Step 3 - Write 3-5 bullet points detailing the key takeaways from each article, and why an eCommerce store owner should care.    Step 4 - Write a unique "SEO Tip of the Month" to feature at the beginning of the newsletter that is helpful and actionable.    Step 5 - Publish to Wordpress    ### Expectations ###    I'm hoping to automate as much or all of this process as possible, while generating outputs that are very close to the previous newsletter examples:  - <https://www.180marketing.com/this-month-in-ecommerce-seo-may-2024/>  - <https://www.180marketing.com/this-month-in-ecommerce-seo-june-2024/>  - <https://www.180marketing.com/this-month-in-ecommerce-seo-july-2024/>    I will be testing the automation for December 2024 to assess the quality of the newsletter. There's a few things I will be looking for.  1. How appealing are the selected articles for an eCommerce store owner?  2. How well written are the article summaries?  3. How insightful are the article takeaways?  4. Does the style and tone match the newsletter examples provided?
